front.title: Utilizing HIP (Host Identity Protocol) for P2PSIP (Peer-to-peer Session Initiation Protocol)

abstract.t: This document specifies how Host Identity Protocol (HIP) can beutilized in Peer-to-Peer Session Initiation Protocol (P2PSIP)networks. Peers in a P2PSIP network need to have long-livedconnections to other peers in the network, and HIP can be utilized tosetup and maintain those connections. HIP is a good choice forconnection maintenance, because it provides functionalities likeNetwork Address Translation (NAT) traversal, mobility, multi-homing,and enhanced security properties.
